[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Error handling] [Panic safety] Are there any code paths that could panic (unwrap(), expect(), index out of bounds) instead of returning proper errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Edge cases] [Empty string handling] If network IDs, sanitizer names, or error messages contain empty strings, does this cause validation bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Edge cases] [Maximum networks] Is there a limit on the number of fullnode networks? Can attackers configure thousands of networks to cause memory exhaustion during validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Edge cases] [Malformed ChainId] If ChainId::mainnet() or is_mainnet() contain bugs, can attackers bypass mainnet-specific security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Test coverage] [Missing negative tests] Do tests cover all error paths and edge cases, or are there uncovered validation branches that attackers can exploit? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Test coverage] [Mainnet tests] Do tests specifically validate mainnet configurations, or can mainnet-specific vulnerabilities go undetected? (High)
[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Test coverage] [Concurrent sanitization] Are there tests that validate thread-safety and concurrent sanitization behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Test methodology] [Skip sanitizer test] Test at line 212 explicitly tests skip_config_sanitizer=true with bad config - is this feature intended for production or only testing? If production, this is a critical bypass! (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [Malicious validator onboarding] Can a new validator join with skip_config_sanitizer=true, bypassing all security checks, then participate in consensus with an unsafe configuration causing chain splits? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [Configuration injection] Can an attacker modify a validator's configuration file mid-flight (before sanitization) to inject malicious network configs that allow eavesdropping on consensus messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [Downgrade attack] Can an attacker initially configure a node as fullnode to pass lax validation, then escalate to validator at runtime bypassing validator-specific security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [Network partition] Can an attacker configure validators with mismatched network configs that pass validation but cause network partitioning during consensus? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [Sybil attack] Can an attacker create multiple validator identities with subtly different but all valid network configs to increase their network presence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Attack scenario] [MITM through disabled auth] If mutual_authentication is somehow disabled through validation bypass, can MITM attackers inject forged consensus messages causing double-spending? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Integration dependency] [Consensus config dependency] Does ConsensusConfig::sanitize() depend on validated network configurations? If not, can consensus be configured incorrectly despite network validation passing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Integration dependency] [Storage config dependency] Does StorageConfig validation ensure consistency with network and consensus configs, or can mismatches cause state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Integration dependency] [Mempool config] Can mempool be misconfigured to accept invalid transactions even if other configs are validated correctly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Integration dependency] [API exposure] Does ApiConfig validation prevent exposure of validator-only APIs on fullnodes, or can attackers query sensitive validator data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Function: sanitize_failpoints_config()] [Conditional compilation] If failpoints are compiled out for mainnet builds, does are_failpoints_enabled() always return false, or can runtime manipulation enable them? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Function: sanitize_fullnode_network_configs()] [Empty vec vs None] Why is fullnode_networks a Vec instead of Option<Vec>? Can an empty vec bypass validation differently than None? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Function: sanitize_validator_network_config()] [Mutual auth implementation] Does checking mutual_authentication boolean in config guarantee actual mutual TLS is enforced, or can implementation bugs bypass this? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Function: NodeConfig::sanitize()] [Sub-config ordering significance] Is the order of sub-config sanitization (lines 51-67) security-critical? Can reordering enable new attack vectors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Boundary condition] [Maximum fullnode networks] What is the maximum allowed number of fullnode network configs? Can integer overflow occur in network iteration or HashSet operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/config_sanitizer.rs] [Boundary condition] [Network ID exhaustion] Are there a finite number of valid NetworkId values? Can attackers exhaust the namespace causing legitimate configs to fail validation? (Low)
